short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: save your RAM by making a convenient list out of all open tabs

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This is a chrome extension that allows the user to collect all the open tabs as a list to save RAM usage. I know other similar extensions like this exist but I was concerned about their privacy and a lot of them seem to have frills. So I made one that was as readable and as lightweight as I felt I could get away with so even a user unfamiliar with programming could be sure no shenanigans are going on.

Button Functionality:

Save and Close: saves and closes tabs open in the current window. In interests of privacy any instance of extension only has access to a single window.

Restore All: Restores all tabs saved in History, but does not remove them from the history.

Restore and Remove All: Restores all the tabs saved in history and removes them from the history.

Remove All: Removes all tabs from the history without restoring them.

Undo Remove All: For a period of time after you deleted the history you can still restore it.

"Printable Version" checkbox: transforms clickable URLs into text web addresses in case you want to back up the tabs you had open by copy-pasting it in a notepad or similar.
